caption: Great beers and the friendliest staff. There is a beer style for every preference. I highly recommend the Imperial Stouts.
What’s not to like

Delish beer. Ordered for delivery Upstate and they included a yummy treat too. Their Deadlock Victim is pretty amazing. You can taste all the flavors without any of them being offputting. Definitely glad they can ship outside of the City. Keep up the Hoptastic work 🍻.
Best beer in New York! I love the collaboration batches and I cant wait to visit again!
Great beer, great tap house.
There are pre-made mixed 4 packs available.  I can't wait to try them. Too bad the tap isn't operational. I look forward for the time the liquid flows for on site imbibers.
Very good beer,awesome can art,creative names friendly staff,can pick up for now
large crowd friendly, good for people watching, but expensive, so it really depends on how much you like their beer. i like it well enough.
Great space for hanging with great beer and games

Grew brews. Flights are a good way to try multiple. Can also get cans to go.  Vibe was super fun, people selling food, and plenty of board games. Like many of these breweries, a bit tight (especially on a weekend), so you might be up close to someone who just ran 10 miles and is now in a onesie.  Anyways, great beers, and the vibe is as good as you make it.  Also, if you're debating coming for an afternoon, make sure to check out the area / surrounding blocks -- this spot is in a sweet part of Bushwick
Fabulous place. Excellent beer selection with slider options so to you can try them all. Very dog friendly. Lots of board games. They also let you bring in outside food, which is great.
Excellent beers, friendly staff, decent prices. Make sure to try a sour as they do a terrific job with them—-one of the best in the country.
Next to Other Half, this is the only other brewery you need to fuss over in Brooklyn. Enjoyable and original beers. Pleasant beertenders. Good vibes.
Truly one of the great breweries of Brooklyn. If you are in Brooklyn for beer cannot miss this place however you will regret it for the rest of your life.

Really nice beer, but the one staff member was exceptionally rude, with a bad attitude, and soured the whole experience. As I have seen from other reviews it seems to be a common theme. I won’t be going back because of it.

KCBC makes fantastic beer but my favorite part of KCBC is the art. Whether in cans or merch KCBC has in my opinion the coolest art of any brewery. Some of my favorites include This is your brain on hops and robot fish. The beer is of course delicious and the brewery is a great place to stop and grab a beer.
Love this place!  Got to drink a delicious stout and pet someone’s doggo!  Nice staff and a good location.  Bathrooms were clean and I loved the tiles with the semi spheres on them.  We will return!
Awesome! Great to hang out with friends!

(Translated by Google) Very cool as a place and the choice of beer is excellent. We can bring food from outside because nothing to sell on the spot.  (Original) Très cool comme place et le choix de biere est excellent.  On peut apporter de la nourriture de l'extérieur car rien a vendre sur place.
What an amazing brewery! 🍻
One of the best craft brewings in NYC
Great brewery and a must visit, could have happily sat there all evening working my way through the selection
Planning my trip to New York I found KCBC on IG. Glad I came across them, great tap room and great beers

Love this place. Literally a gem in the neighborhood. They always change up their brews. The beer is never less than excellent. Great place to go after dinning around the area, or roll in with the kids / it is stroller friendly after lunch / early dinner. They let you buy food outside and bring it in, but nowadays I saw they had a food truck in there on the weekend. They have lots of games to entertain everyone of all ages. The beer selection and tastings alone are entertaining enough- not to mention the names they pick for their beers!
Pleasant brewery with a variety of beers.
Having been a fan of their beer (and cans) for some time, I was happy to finally stop by the brewery. No frills, an industrial space, but very good beer - made the most of the "flight" option.

BEACH ZOMBIE IS THE ULTIMATE SUMMERTIME BREW!  Also an Amazing brewery, varied and rigorously updated selections (not just beer!) You can smell the aromas of brewing while tasting their amazing product. Always cool AC, nice weekly food pop-ups, and clean bathrooms.
A great, no frills tap room with fantastic beer and friendly staff. Dog friendly too!
gooood everything
great beer, they used to be good for a beer and a chat with friends now it’s too damm loud
Awesome brewery, and quite the happening place. Lots of patrons, which speaks to the beer on tap. They have a fridge with cans to go. Beer is great, staff helpful, despite the place being busy.
Great beer.  Cool facility.  Great service.  Easily accessible for such a popular spot.
The beer and staff are amazing!! Great place and vibe. They are Incredibly involved in NYC conservation efforts (wildlife, birds etc) to boot!!
Good selection of beers, flights are $15 tho.. and games galore

(Translated by Google) Very nice and cozy place, great music and fabulous beers, all to try. Highly recommended if you are in those parts in search of street art ;-)  (Original) Locale molto bello e accogliente, ottima musica e delle birre favolose, tutte da provare. Consigliatissimo se siete da quelle parti in cerca della street art ;-)
Goooooood.
Cool place, some beers like my nice Pilsner was at friendly $6. But, one of the smallest "pints" I have ever seen. Lets stick to generally recognized volume and measurement standards.
Best brewery in NYC.
Good beers. Not so friendly bartender, some if the clientele very rude and obnoxious. We will go back though it could have just been the afternoon.
Great place
Really great place to chill. Kcbc makes great beer. Come stop by and have a beer or 2. Enjoy old bushwick
Great beers and a friendly staff!
Cool vibe, good music, great variety of beers. Flight of 4 dmall beers for tasting is $15. Plenty of games available.
Great brewery with a delicious rotating variety of beers and awesome staff
Wow! What a place! The beer the vibe, awesome! Worth the visit. Oh! Don't forget to try the empanadas, I'll recommend the ones of cow.
Loved the beer, the music, the ambiance and the boardgames.
Great craft beers at this tap room.
Top notch brew. Nuff said.
Great beer
Great Beers
Great beer and atmosphere.

Excellent but indifferent to the taproom. Small place with many hard, reflective surfaces. It was crowded so this means it was very loud - uncomfortably so. Barkeeps were indifferent, not especially friendly and had to wait a while to be noticed when waiting for a drink. Most importantly, the flight of four beers ranged from very good to truly outstanding.
Always a great selection!
Best place to grab an incredible beer and chat with good folks
Great brewery, love their beers. Nice variety, too
Great place excellent service wonderful bears but we're all the Brown ales
Awesome place to grab a craft beer and amazing selection all made in house!
Nice space. Average beer. They had a very good sour!

Super quality beer, in a beautiful space, with a great staff; what more could you ask for.  Seriously though, these guys are killing it and you should get here now .... and often. So excited to have them on the brewing scene here in Brooklyn. Cheers KCBC!

Beautiful, plant filled inside and amazing beers.  Lots of love for IPAs and Sours here and zero complaints from me about it.  Staff has been friendly and attentive every time I’ve been here.  Drink beer here.
Great Beer! Great Plants!
Absolutely amazing
It's a brewery so you can bring your dog. Come enjoy a beer and hang with your pup at the same time.
Some of the best craft beer in the world. Outstanding.
Top notch! Great beer, chill location!!

KCBC always has delicious, lovingly crafted beers on tap, many of them being top-tier collaborations with local places. The service is always fast and courteous and the bathrooms are generally clean. There are board games to play, or bring your own, and dogs are super welcome.

Along with the other breweries we toured last weekend we made sure to stop by KCBC, as we've been fans of their beer for a long time but have never made it to the brewery itself. In comparison to the other breweries we stopped at KCBC actually seemed a lot larger, less crowded but still very populated, and we had no problem getting a seat at the bar. The beer was great, and KCBC seemed to be the most cleanly of all the breweries we stopped at that day (and most well-lit!). The staff was great and we will definitely go there again when we're in town.
The beer isn't any better or worse than anywhere else, but the volume the DJ insists on is unbearable.
Good beers in a friendly atmosphere.
(Translated by Google) Very good own and guest beers, with a very pleasant atmosphere  (Original) Muy buenas cervezas propias e invitadas, con un ambiente muy agradable
The best brewery in North Brooklyn.

KCBC is easily the best brewery in New York City. And there are other fine breweries, this one has never lead me astray and has introduced me to varieties I was not aware of. It also seems like a good date spot based on the ratio that seems more balanced than most tap rooms.

Great beer in a fun open space with communal tables. Certainly not the best brewery in the area, but KCBC is definitely trending upward lately with their hops and sours. Love that its bring your own food.
Service was great, beers even better.

If you are interested in international quality beer, I wouldn't come here. This is more of a ipa and upstate craft beer kind of place. Packed with young Bushwick crowd and groups playing boardgame and loud music playing, this happened on a busy hot summer day. I am sure it's less loud and crowded on a quiet night.  I think I only saw susage on a bun the only food option here. Rest are selection of 15 beer ipa. At $6 to $8 a pop, you can enjoy it for a good 20 minutes or at least for me. I am not a fan of these beer because they don't taste good to me. If you like German beer, I advise you to stay away.  Place is huge but still hard to find a place to sit.
The Best. Rotating taps of excellent beers. Great atmosphere. Kid and dog friendly. Go!
Awesome place for local beers!

Space opens to the exterior during the summer, which is nice. All the beers I tried very well done and well-balanced, and they didn't overdo any of the flavors (e.g. blood orange sour wasn't too orangey, hellesbock wasn't too smoky, etc). The backbone of every beer was fantastic. When it gets packed, it's a bit loud, so if you don't like crowds, I recommend going on a weekday.
(Translated by Google) Very cool place, quality beers but not at the level of Belgian beers!  (Original) Lieu très cool, bières de qualité mais pas au niveau des bières belges !
Nice open space and atmosphere, beers are really good but only 14 oz pours. Used to west coast brewery’s with standard 16 oz pints.
Some of the best beers in NYC.  Great space, too
Best beer. Best people. Best time.
Terrific local brewery with good music!

Really nice taproom located in an old wearhouse. Six to twelve beers on tap, and one local cider. A couple of cans and bottles to stay or to go. Giant windows facing the streets lights up the space during the day, and even gives you a little bit of outdoor vibe during the summer when they're open. Can get pretty busy during the weekends but you can usually find a place to sit. Dog friendly. Bonus point for the L train info on top of the fridge.
Very busy and loud but great beer!
Great tap room for day drinking and hanging out. They were cool with me bringing in some pizza from around the corner. The session IPA is a great all rounder.
Nice music,  good beer !
Loads of tasty beers, good music.
Five stars because my wife liked the beer enough she bought some and brought it home with her.
Great spot, great beer!
Weekly changing beer selection chill crowd settlers of Catan
Great beers on tap, pretty open floorplan though not super big. Would recommend for day drinking over a night spot.

KCBC is a trio of experienced brewers who have joined forces to bring their shared vision of quality, variety and community to craft beer drinkers throughout New York City and beyond. They love working together, they love drinking together, and there super-duper excited to bring their fresh & flavorful beers to life here in Brooklyn.  After several years of brewing in tiny apartments, at the American Brewers Guild in Vermont, and professionally at breweries across the city, they all independently came to the same conclusion: wouldn’t it be FRICKIN’ AWESOME to open a new brewery in NYC? Flash forward in time, and after various trials and tribulations (and many long drinking sessions together), they realized that if they combined their efforts, they could build a bigger, better, more bada$$ brewery than if they each tried to do it alone. And thus: Kings County Brewers Collective (KCBC) was officially born.  Food: No food here but your more then welcome to bring your own food to pair with their awesome beer menu.  Brew: They serve up some killler DDH beers and solid German Pilsners. They also do growler fills and cans to go.
Great beer. Great selection.
Great beer, friendly bartenders, overall great space.
Bit of trek but with spending an afternoon here
Excelent craft beer :)
Is good
Broad beer selection, close to the train, hip vibes. Local brews.

Great local brewery and taproom. Every time I've been there, the quality and selection of beers left nothing to be desired. The space is well designed with plenty of tables and a polished look that doesn't make you forget you're in a brewery. They also have board games, food popups and events.

(Translated by Google) Good atmosphere and a lot of variety of craft beers. It is in the center of Bushwick and when the weather is nice it is open to the street, making it a very nice place to have a few beers while you see the graffiti of the neighborhood.  (Original) Buen ambiente y mucha variedad de cervezas artesanas. Está en el centro de Bushwick y cuando hace buen tiempo está abierta a la calle, por lo que es un lugar muy agradable donde tomar unas cervezas mientras ves los grafitis del barrio.
Awesome staff all the time, great selection beers always on the go.
Nice space and quite good beers. I was pretty impressed that everything I tried was very good.
Safe Flight IPA 5☆☆☆☆☆
This place rules.
Excellent selection of local beers and extremely reasonable prices. I wish I could deduct a star for this place basically making it impossible for me to NOT spend all my money here, but alas...
Currently have multiple sours😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😻😻😻😍😍
Awesome selection, awesome beers, awesome neighborhood. Loved all the beers I had here, and they always have an interesting assortment.
Nice beer, nice bar.
These guys are legit.
Great beer, nice crowd... cool place all around...
Great staff, open, inviting space, and a respectable selection of fairly unique beers to sample your way through. Tabletop gaming encouraged!
AMAZING BEER. Super reasonable price. You could bring food in last time I was here so order some arepas from nearby...
Really good, gorgeous space
Great chill spot, great beer and friendly staff.

Delicious cooperative brewery with fresh and original beers on draft. Check the schedule because pop up art and food offerings are often available. Worth a visit if you like a good beer in a brewery-like space.
These guys sure know what they're doing...and brewing!
A great open space to chill out, order in some pizza, and play cards… and if you ask nicely you may get a tour. The beers are spot on: I particularly enjoyed the citra-hopped IPA and the saison.
Quaint little brewery with a great selection.

gonna give this 4 stars. really like the space. crowd was pleasant. clean and fun playing games. the beer just didn't stand out for me. was hoping to be surprised by taste and after trying 2 flights i just wasn't that impressed. bartenders were also a little inattentive.
A really fun spot. Take a group and play some board games while you drink beer. Be sure to check out where the beer is made in the back. The Porter was my top choice.
A must visit! Great beer. Great atmosphere. Cool neighborhood too!

Super friendly, casual, and delicious beer!  These guys bring in the best people, have the best board games, and are really knowledgeable about what they sell.  Try the Beach Zombie - my personal fave!
Great brews in a friendly setting.

(Translated by Google) A brewery in the Brooklyn area of ​​New York. A variety of beers can be sampled and it is a must for beer lovers. The inside is very beautiful unlike the outside streets. The service at the counter was very good, and the music that was playing was good.  (Original) ニューヨークのブルックリン地区にあるビールの醸造所です。色々な種類のビールを試飲でき、ビール好きにはたまりません。外の街並とは全く違って中はとても綺麗です。カウンターのサービスもとても良く、流れていた音楽もセンスが良かったです。
Great beers
Cool new place, great beer selection
Delicious beers, beautiful space, welcoming staff. Awesome.
Great beers,  nice place and mostly nice bartenders
Amazing beers!

Sweet set-up with original interior fittings - not sure about the low tables though.  The beers we tried were excellent - Robot Fish being my personal go-to beer.  Bring a friend and you could stay awhile without knowing it...
Great beer, awesome and friendly staff.. Great place to hangout and chill with friends.
Bright and airy space with great beer.
Super delicious craft brews!! Definitely coming back!

We were lucky enough to try Robot Fish at the beach with friends. One of the best beers we've ever tasted. After that taste we signed up for a membership and got a few Crowlers. The Sandcastles Saison and Dangerous Precedent did not disappoint. We can't wait for the taproom to open so we can bring all our beer loving pals.
Awesome beer! Can't wait for the taproom.
So pumped for another great micro brewery in Brooklyn. Owners are great guys and the space looks huge. Beers are top-notch too.
Awesome beer from talented craft-folks!
Awesome beer, had their stuff at several home brew events. these guys-are gonna do great things, cant wait for this to open!
It just IS. Stay tuned for the opening of the tap room in a few months!!

I have sampled their beers at various brew events, and wow are they tasty!  Fresh, interesting, and fun.  Also a great group of guys who are not only knowledgeable but also friendly and willing to share!
Always something interesting.
